trans-unit.source: ms.ContentId: 71a03c62-50fd-48dc-9296-4d285027a96a title: Setup Windows Containers in a local VM
trans-unit.target: ms.ContentId: 71a03c62-50fd-48dc-9296-4d285027a96a title: Setup Windows Containers in a local VM

trans-unit.source: Preparing Windows Server Technical Preview for Windows Server Containers
trans-unit.target: Preparing Windows Server Technical Preview for Windows Server Containers

trans-unit.source: In order to create and manage Windows Server Containers, the Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview environment must be prepared.
trans-unit.target: In order to create and manage Windows Server Containers, the Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview environment must be prepared.

trans-unit.source: This guide will walk through configuring Windows Server Containers in a Hyper-V Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: This guide will walk through configuring Windows Server Containers in a Hyper-V Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Other getting started guides:
trans-unit.target: Other getting started guides:

trans-unit.source: Run Windows Server Containers in
trans-unit.target: Run Windows Server Containers in

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Run Windows Server Containers in
trans-unit.target: Run Windows Server Containers in

trans-unit.source: an existing virtual machine
trans-unit.target: an existing virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Setup Windows Server Containers
trans-unit.target: Setup Windows Server Containers

trans-unit.source: on a physical Windows Server Core installation
trans-unit.target: on a physical Windows Server Core installation

trans-unit.source: PLEASE READ PRIOR TO INSTALLING THE CONTAINER OS IMAGE:
trans-unit.target: PLEASE READ PRIOR TO INSTALLING THE CONTAINER OS IMAGE:

trans-unit.source: The license terms of the Microsoft Windows Server Pre-Release software (“License Terms”) apply to your use of the Microsoft Windows Container OS Image supplement (the “supplemental software).
trans-unit.target: The license terms of the Microsoft Windows Server Pre-Release software (“License Terms”) apply to your use of the Microsoft Windows Container OS Image supplement (the “supplemental software).

trans-unit.source: By downloading and using the supplemental software, you agree to the License Terms, and you may not use it if you have not accepted the License Terms.
trans-unit.target: By downloading and using the supplemental software, you agree to the License Terms, and you may not use it if you have not accepted the License Terms.

trans-unit.source: Both the Windows Server Pre-Release software and the supplemental software are licensed by Microsoft Corporation.
trans-unit.target: Both the Windows Server Pre-Release software and the supplemental software are licensed by Microsoft Corporation.

trans-unit.source: System running Windows 10 / Windows Server Technical Preview 2 or later.
trans-unit.target: System running Windows 10 / Windows Server Technical Preview 2 or later.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V role enabled (
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V role enabled (

trans-unit.source: see instructions
trans-unit.target: see instructions

trans-unit.source: 20GB available storage for container host image, OS Base Image and setup scripts.
trans-unit.target: 20GB available storage for container host image, OS Base Image and setup scripts.

trans-unit.source: Administrator permissions on the Hyper-V host.
trans-unit.target: Administrator permissions on the Hyper-V host.

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Containers do not require Hyper-V however to keep things simple this guide assumes that a Hyper-V environment is being used to run the Windows Server Container host.
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Containers do not require Hyper-V however to keep things simple this guide assumes that a Hyper-V environment is being used to run the Windows Server Container host.

trans-unit.source: Setup a New Container Host on a New Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Setup a New Container Host on a New Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Containers consist of several components such as the Windows Server Container Host and Container OS Base Image.
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Containers consist of several components such as the Windows Server Container Host and Container OS Base Image.

trans-unit.source: We have put together a script that will download and configure these items for you.
trans-unit.target: We have put together a script that will download and configure these items for you.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to deploy a new Hyper-V Virtual Machine and configure this system as a Windows Server Container Host.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to deploy a new Hyper-V Virtual Machine and configure this system as a Windows Server Container Host.

trans-unit.source: Start a PowerShell session as Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Start a PowerShell session as Administrator.

trans-unit.source: This can be done by right clicking on the PowerShell icon and selecting ‘Run as Administrator’, or by running the following command from any PowerShell session.
trans-unit.target: This can be done by right clicking on the PowerShell icon and selecting ‘Run as Administrator’, or by running the following command from any PowerShell session.

trans-unit.source: ``` powershell start-process powershell -Verb runAs
trans-unit.target: ``` powershell start-process powershell -Verb runAs

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to create and configure the container host where
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to create and configure the container host where

trans-unit.source: will be the virtual machine name and
trans-unit.target: will be the virtual machine name and

trans-unit.source: will be the password assigned to the Administrator account.
trans-unit.target: will be the password assigned to the Administrator account.

trans-unit.source: ``` powershell .\New-ContainerHost.ps1 –VmName <containerhost> -Password <password>
trans-unit.target: ``` powershell .\New-ContainerHost.ps1 –VmName <containerhost> -Password <password>

trans-unit.source: Before installing and using the Windows Server Technical Preview 3 with Containers virtual machine you must: 1.
trans-unit.target: Before installing and using the Windows Server Technical Preview 3 with Containers virtual machine you must: 1.

trans-unit.source: Review the license terms by navigating to this link: http://aka.ms/WindowsServerTP3ContainerVHDEula 2.
trans-unit.target: Review the license terms by navigating to this link: http://aka.ms/WindowsServerTP3ContainerVHDEula 2.

trans-unit.source: Print and retain a copy of the license terms for your records.
trans-unit.target: Print and retain a copy of the license terms for your records.

trans-unit.source: By downloading and using the Windows Server Technical Preview 3 with Containers virtual machine you agree to such license terms.
trans-unit.target: By downloading and using the Windows Server Technical Preview 3 with Containers virtual machine you agree to such license terms.

trans-unit.source: Please confirm you have accepted and agree to the license terms.
trans-unit.target: Please confirm you have accepted and agree to the license terms.

trans-unit.source: [N] No [Y] Yes [?] Help (default is "N"): Y
trans-unit.target: [N] No [Y] Yes [?] Help (default is "N"): Y

trans-unit.source: This VM is not connected to the network.
trans-unit.target: This VM is not connected to the network.

trans-unit.source: To connect it, run the following: Get-VM | Get-VMNetworkAdapter | Connect-VMNetworkAdapter -Switchname <switchname>
trans-unit.target: To connect it, run the following: Get-VM | Get-VMNetworkAdapter | Connect-VMNetworkAdapter -Switchname <switchname>

trans-unit.source: When the configuration script has completed, start the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: When the configuration script has completed, start the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The VM is configured with Windows Server 2016 Core and will look like the following.
trans-unit.target: The VM is configured with Windows Server 2016 Core and will look like the following.

trans-unit.source: <center>
trans-unit.target: <center>

trans-unit.source: Finally log into the virtual machine using the password specified during the configuration process and make sure that the Virtual Machine has a valid IP address.
trans-unit.target: Finally log into the virtual machine using the password specified during the configuration process and make sure that the Virtual Machine has a valid IP address.

trans-unit.source: With these items completed your system should be ready for Windows Server Containers.
trans-unit.target: With these items completed your system should be ready for Windows Server Containers.

trans-unit.target: Next Steps - Start Using Containers

trans-unit.target: Now that you have a Windows Server 2016 system running the Windows Server Container feature jump to the following guides to begin working with Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container images.
